#libraries
library(tswge)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)
# Set this to data folder for your file
setwd("/Users/mingyang/Desktop/SMU/TimeSeries/TimeSeriesFinalProject/data")

# One data Point 1985-09-01 was imputed by taking average of august and October
us.electricity = read.csv("averageprice_electricity_US.csv",col.names = c("DATE", "AVG_EP"), 
                          colClasses = c(DATE="character", AVG_EP="numeric"))

dim(us.electricity)
head(us.electricity)
tail(us.electricity)
str(us.electricity)

cpi = read.csv("CPIAUCSL.csv")
dim(cpi)
head(cpi)
tail(cpi)
str(cpi)

us.pop = read.csv("POPTHM.csv")
dim(us.pop)
head(us.pop)
tail(us.pop)
str(us.pop)

gas.price = read.csv("GASREGM.csv")
dim(gas.price)
head(gas.price)
tail(gas.price)
str(gas.price)


plotts.wge(us.electricity$AVG_EP)
plotts.wge(cpi$CPIAUCSL)
plotts.wge(gas.price$GASREGM)

which(us.electricity$DATE=="1991-02-01") # 148
us.electricity = us.electricity[148:520,]
rownames(us.electricity) <- 1:nrow(us.electricity)
head(us.electricity)

which(cpi$DATE=="1991-02-01")
cpi = cpi[148:520,]
rownames(cpi) <- 1:nrow(cpi)
head(cpi)

df = us.electricity
df$CPI = cpi$CPIAUCSL
df$GASP = gas.price$GASREGM
head(df)

plotts.wge(df$AVG_EP)
plotts.wge(df$CPI)
plotts.wge(df$GASP)
